post_text:
We have a couple important changes we wanted to relay to you. First, after further talks with the Madison County Health Commissioner and all options available, Jefferson Local Schools has decided to move the Middle School and High School to a hybrid model instead of having students attend 5 days a week.

Half the students will attend Mon and Tuesday (Group A) and the other half on Thursday and Friday (Group B). The other 3 days when students are not in the building, they will be participating in e-learning. Group assignments are currently being worked on and will be coming soon.

On Wednesdays the buildings will be cleaned thoroughly. This change will allow students a better chance of…
text:
We have a couple important changes we wanted to relay to you. First, after further talks with the Madison County Health Commissioner and all options available, Jefferson Local Schools has decided to move the Middle School and High School to a hybrid model instead of having students attend 5 days a week.

Half the students will attend Mon and Tuesday (Group A) and the other half on Thursday and Friday (Group B). The other 3 days when students are not in the building, they will be participating in e-learning. Group assignments are currently being worked on and will be coming soon.

On Wednesdays the buildings will be cleaned thoroughly. This change will allow students a better chance of…

post_text:
Notice: Vacancy of School Board Member
The Jefferson Local School District Board of Education is seeking qualified applicants to fill a vacant Board position. You must be a registered voter of the School District, to be considered. This vacancy became available June 18, 2020.
Resumes and applications should be submitted by Friday July 24, 2020 to the district office at 906 W. Main St., West Jefferson, OH; or email at: board@westjeff.org.

The Board term will begin with the appointment by the School Board, August 10, 2020 and expire December 31, 2021.
text:
Notice: Vacancy of School Board Member
The Jefferson Local School District Board of Education is seeking qualified applicants to fill a vacant Board position. You must be a registered voter of the School District, to be considered. This vacancy became available June 18, 2020.
Resumes and applications should be submitted by Friday July 24, 2020 to the district office at 906 W. Main St., West Jefferson, OH; or email at: board@westjeff.org.

The Board term will begin with the appointment by the School Board, August 10, 2020 and expire December 31, 2021.

post_text:
This was emailed to all families where we had an email address:

Parents - The Ohio Department of Education (ODE) has asked all school districts to ask their families about internet access at their home residence. ODE knows there were challenges with online learning, with internet access being just one. We would like to ask that you complete this quick survey if you have a child in grades K-11. Couple things about the survey:

1. We really only need to know if you DO NOT have some type of internet access (cable internet, satellite internet, mobile hotspot, etc), but if you'd like to fill out the survey and say yes, that is fine too.
2. If you have multiple students at home, please fill…
text:
This was emailed to all families where we had an email address:

Parents - The Ohio Department of Education (ODE) has asked all school districts to ask their families about internet access at their home residence. ODE knows there were challenges with online learning, with internet access being just one. We would like to ask that you complete this quick survey if you have a child in grades K-11. Couple things about the survey:

1. We really only need to know if you DO NOT have some type of internet access (cable internet, satellite internet, mobile hotspot, etc), but if you'd like to fill out the survey and say yes, that is fine too.
2. If you have multiple students at home, please fill…

post_text: Jefferson Local Schools will be conducting a virtual graduation for this year's 2020 graduating class. The ceremony will be available to view on Friday evening, May 22. Beginning Saturday morning May 23 students will be able to receive diplomas in person at the high school. More information on the details of the ceremony and diploma pick up will be forthcoming.

post_text:
A Message from the High School and Middle School:

On Monday, April 20th, Gov. DeWine announced the closure of school buildings for the remainder of the academic year. In preparation for Gov. DeWine’s decision, the administration
investigated several different grading systems for the 4th nine weeks. The ultimate goal was to make sure no students had to endure academic harm because of circumstances out of their
control. Listed below are the procedures the middle and high school will utilize to calculate the 4th nine weeks grades. The high school procedures for calculating final grades for year-long and semester courses are also listed.

Click link below for more information:

https://filecabinet7.eschoolview.com/FAB891FC-ADB7-4CB3-9075-8EE31FC6760F/Grading%20Procedures/GradingProceduresfor4thNineWeeks_Students_Parents.pdf

post_text: A new message from Norwood!

post_text:
HS/MS Media Center :

Sunday is the last day to request books for the Media Center Curbside Book Pick Up. Parents and Students, please check your email for more details. Pick up will be Tuesday from 11:30-12:30.
text:
HS/MS Media Center :

Sunday is the last day to request books for the Media Center Curbside Book Pick Up. Parents and Students, please check your email for more details. Pick up will be Tuesday from 11:30-12:30.

post_text:
The MS/HS Media Center will be hosting a Curbside Book Pickup. Students grades 6-12 may select to receive up to 4 books. Students will select which genres they prefer and if they know which titles I will do my best to accommodate. Otherwise, the books will be randomly selected from the genre(s) chosen. All responses to this form must be completed by Sunday, April 26th.

On Tuesday, April 28th, from 11:30-12:30 parents or students may come to the front of the HIGH SCHOOL to collect the books. Labeled bags will be lined up along the curb for pick up or can be placed in your trunk upon arrival.

LINK HERE: https://forms.gle/d2DxowknWfHUHMvAA

post_text: The first message from Norwood Staff! Watch for more to come!
text: The first message from Norwood Staff! Watch for more to come!

post_text:
**FOOD SERVICE UPDATE 3/30/20**
Food Service staff will be serving Grab-and-Go Meals for lunch and breakfast from 11:00 am until 12:00 pm on the following days

This Week
Wednesday April 1
Thursday April 2

Week of April 6th
Monday April 6
Wednesday April 8

The following next 3 weeks they will only be done once a week on Mondays.
Monday April 13
Monday April 20
Monday April 27

These meals are Free of charge and available to All students K-12 who attend Jefferson Local Schools. You will only need students Pin numbers that they use during lunch time to pick up meals.

Pick-up locations at this time will be at the High School student parking lot and Norwood where students are picked up. Please pick up meals from whichever location is most convenient for your family.

If you have any questions please call Christine Elkins at the school (614-879-7681 x2400) or email her through her staff email at celkins@westjeff.org.

post_text:
This is from the office of Ohio Consumer Counsel:
On March 24 at 9:00 a.m., Andrew Tinkham will be providing an educational call on how utility consumers can keep their utilities connected and other topics during these challenging times. During the call, he plans to discuss the following topics:



Utility Disconnection Suspension
Winter Reconnect Order Extension
Utility Assistance Programs
Utility Payment Plans
Medical Certification Waiver
PUCO Order on Door-to-Door Energy Marketers

He plans to offer these calls on a weekly basis until we get through this current situation, especially since information changes on a daily basis. Please RSVP if you plan to call in at: andrew.tinkham@occ.ohio.gov



You may join the educational call by dialing 614-230-0229. Once connected, please enter the meeting code 907748.

HS Principal Message:

WJ High School On-line Learning Information
We are encountering unprecedented circumstances both personally and educationally. Our ultimate goal is the safety and well-being of our students, while continuing to provide them with a quality education. With that being said, we have implemented on-line learning, through the use of Google Classroom, to continue the educational process for our students. The following information has been shared with our students and any adjustments will be communicated through the Google Classrooms.

General Information and Procedural Process for Students:

Every Teacher has a Google…

post_text: Beginning on Monday, March 16th, Charter will offer free Spectrum broadband and Wi-Fi access for 60 days to households with K-12 and/or college students who do not already have a Spectrum broadband subscription and at any service level up to 100 Mbps. post_text: As a result of the Coronavirus and the Governor's order, Jefferson Local Schools will be closed on Monday, March 16th thru Friday, April 3rd. All school events and activities are suspended during this three week period. At this time we presume school will resume on Monday, April 6th. We will be sending further information to confirm the resumption of school on April 6th. The district will be utilizing Monday, March 16th and Tues, March 17th as staff work days to prepare e-learning and to clean.

post_text:
The Jefferson Local Board of Education has placed a 3.5 mill emergency levy, for a period of seven years, on the ballot for November 5th.

HOW MUCH WILL THIS EMERGENCY LEVY COST?

If your home was valued at $100,000, it would cost a homeowner $10.21 per month.

If your home was valued at $150,000, it would cost a homeowner $15.31 per month.

If your home was valued at $200,000, it would cost a homeowner $20.42 per month.

HOW MUCH REVENUE WILL IT BRING INTO THE DISTRICT?

$769,711.00 per year for a seven year period.

HOW WILL THE DISTRICT CLOSE THE REMAINING DEFICIT?

The district has begun a program of requiring new businesses in the Industrial Park to pay a 1 cent per square foot side…

Incoming 6th and 10th graders can pick up their new chromebooks and pay for the optional protection plan on Tuesday Aug 13th, from 2pm till 7pm. If you can not pick up your chromebook during this time, please see the technology department once school starts.

Norwood Elementary is in the process of collecting items for their new Makerspace. A makerspace is a place where students can gather to create, invent, explore, and discover using a variety of tools and materials. Below is the list of items they are collecting. They can be new or used. If you have any questions, please contact Mrs. Fry at kfry@westjeff.org

Makerspace Donation List
For Norwood Elementary School Makerspace

Legos
Legos 12X12 for a wall
Magnetics
Magnets
Lincoln logs
Blocks
Tinker Toys
K’Nex blocks
Keva planks
Bristle blocks
Plastic bins with lids all sizes

post_text:
Do you know when to stop for a school bus? The Ohio State Highway Patrol has provided a short video showing Motorists when they are required to stop for a bus with flashing red lights.

For a two-lane road with a center turn lane, Motorists in both lanes of travel are required to stop as well.

Help keep our children safe!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMX_k_awyoE
text:
Do you know when to stop for a school bus? The Ohio State Highway Patrol has provided a short video showing Motorists when they are required to stop for a bus with flashing red lights.

For a two-lane road with a center turn lane, Motorists in both lanes of travel are required to stop as well.

Help keep our children safe!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMX_k_awyoE

YOUTUBE.COM
School Bus Safety Week 2018

post_text:
NOTIFICATION & INFORMATION REGARDING BED BUGS
March 7, 2019

We have recently found evidence of bed bugs in our school buildings and/or on students' belongings. Bed bugs are a nuisance, but their bites are not known to spread disease. Bed bugs are usually active at night and feed on human blood. The bite does not hurt at first, but it may become swollen and itch, much like a mosquito bite. Watch for clusters of bites, usually in a line, on exposed areas of the body. If you have concerns for you or your child, please contact your doctor.

The source of bed bugs often cannot be determined, as bed bugs may be found in many places including hotels, planes, and movie theaters. We have been…

post_text: Parents - This message is from Jefferson Local Schools and is for all parents. Recently in the news, there have been reports of the Momo suicide challenge showing up on Facebook and Youtube and in some cases even video games targeting young children. While some reports are also saying it’s nothing to worry about, we would like to encourage you to have a conversation with your student that while they are on the internet they might run across things like this and if they do they should let a parent, teacher, or other adult know so the video can be reported. If you have any questions, feel free to contact your child's school or the technology department.
text: Parents - This message is from Jefferson Local Schools and is for all parents. Recently in the news, there have been reports of the Momo suicide challenge showing up on Facebook and Youtube and in some cases even video games targeting young children. While some reports are also saying it’s nothing to worry about, we would like to encourage you to have a conversation with your student that while they are on the internet they might run across things like this and if they do they should let a parent, teacher, or other adult know so the video can be reported. If you have any questions, feel free to contact your child's school or the technology department.

post_text:
PM Preschool Drop-off Changes

Starting tomorrow, Wednesday, February 20, 2019, students attending the PM preschool session will need to be dropped off at the back entrance of the school. The gate will be opened at 11:20 AM for the morning session to be picked up and will remain open until 12:15 PM for the afternoon session drop-off. Once the gate is closed, it will not be re-opened and parents/guardians will need to bring the student to the main entrance to sign them in.

Staff will get your child out of the vehicle, please do not get out of your vehicle to bring your child to the door as this will slow down the flow of traffic.

If you have any questions regarding the new drop-off procedures please contact Ms. Calland or Ms. Thompson at Norwood Elementary.

post_text:
5th Grade participated in a video chat with National Geographic.

Abigail Fraeman | NASA Research Scientist

Dr. Abigail Fraeman is a research scientist at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California. She studies rocky bodies across our solar system using orbiting satellites and planetary rovers. Abigail is a member of the Curiosity Mars rover and Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter science teams, and is also the deputy project scientist of the Opportunity Mars rover.
text:
5th Grade participated in a video chat with National Geographic.

Abigail Fraeman | NASA Research Scientist

Dr. Abigail Fraeman is a research scientist at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California. She studies rocky bodies across our solar system using orbiting satellites and planetary rovers. Abigail is a member of the Curiosity Mars rover and Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter science teams, and is also the deputy project scientist of the Opportunity Mars rover.

post_text:
Tolles Shuttle Information

On days that Jefferson Local Schools is not in session (for reasons other than calamity days) the shuttle will transport students from the High School to Tolles. The shuttle will depart from the High School at 7:25 AM. Parents and students will be responsible for getting to the shuttle location. In the afternoon, the shuttle will pickup students from Tolles at approximately 2:45 PM. Student drop off points heading back to West Jefferson are Fisher Cast Steel, West Jefferson High School, and Norwood Elementary.

If Jefferson Local Schools cancels classes due to a calamity, no transportation will be available. If school is delayed 2 hours, the Tolles shuttle will also be on a two-hour delay.

If you have any questions regarding the Tolles shuttle, please contact the Jefferson Local Schools Transportation Department at 614-879-7654 extension 1120.
